basic_info.description: Hi, I’m Hugo Thompson, and I’m a Software Engineer. I started my coding journey about halfway through high school, where I found a game that had a repository anyone could contribute to. I thought the idea of that was really cool and so I self learned a bit of the language to contribute myself. And yeah, delivering features to players and solving long standing design issues for the game was extremely fun, as in, I began to enjoy coding more than I did the game I was coding for! This continued until I graduated, but then came covid, After a lot of deliberation on where I was going to take myself in life, I decided to continue my self learning instead of dealing with online college classes at full price, partially because I assumed covid wasn’t going to be as long as it ended up being. Boy was I wrong about that. I self learned some more for about two years and then decided to get some more formal education on being a software developer, since I had a lot of informal education but I didn’t know what I didn’t know. This led me to code fellows, where I’m currently learning more about the industry.

projects.title: 201 Final
projects.description: The end of my class on the "Foundations of Software Development", I decided to make a little browser game. Wow, what a crunch it turned into! And in the end, it just turned out alright, but what really makes me look back at the project with pride was the systems I made for it, like the popup system and the hintsystem. Super robust use of constructed types, so all in all I'm very happy I decided to take the path of most resistance.

projects.title: Horned Beasts
projects.description: First react project for school, a little fun image repo site. I sure do get carried away with css styling, but it's genuinely fun to find things to improve about the site, even if just a school project people don't really care much about.

projects.title: 301 Final
projects.description: My final project for my react class, which will be here when I'm done!
